name: Verify Import
query:
MATCH (n)
WITH COUNT(n) AS numVertices
MATCH ()-[e]->()
RETURN numVertices, COUNT(e) AS numEdges

name: matches all nodes
query: MATCH (n) RETURN n

name: Schema-level visualization of db
query: CALL db.schema.visualization()

name: Check if movie exists
query:
MATCH (m:Movie {title: "The Bridges of Madison County"})
RETURN m

name: Check if actor/director exists
query:
MATCH (p:Person {name: "Clint Eastwood"})
RETURN p

name: Create Movie and Person that do not exist
query:
CREATE (:Movie {title: "The Bridges of Madison County", released: 1995})
CREATE (:Person {name: "Meryl Streep", born: 1949})
CREATE (:Person {name: "Annie Corlay", born: 1960})

name: Create ActedIn and Directed Relationships
query:
MATCH (m:Movie {title: "The Bridges of Madison County"})
MATCH (a1:Person {name: "Clint Eastwood"})
MATCH (a2:Person {name: "Meryl Streep"})
MATCH (a3:Person {name: "Annie Corlay"})
MERGE (a1)-[:ACTED_IN]->(m)
MERGE (a2)-[:ACTED_IN]->(m)
MERGE (a3)-[:ACTED_IN]->(m)
MERGE (a1)-[:DIRECTED]->(m)

name: Verify nodes add and relations
query:
MATCH (p:Person)-[r]->(m:Movie {title: "The Bridges of Madison County"})
RETURN p.name AS Person, type(r) AS Relationship, m.title AS Movie

name: Find all actors that directed a movie they also acted in and return actor and movie nodes.
query:
MATCH (p:Person)-[:ACTED_IN]->(m:Movie)<-[:DIRECTED]-(p)
RETURN p, m

name: Find the name of the actor who played DeDe in the movie “Joe Versus the Volcano”
query:
MATCH (actor:Person)-[r:ACTED_IN]->(movie:Movie {title: "Joe Versus the Volcano"})
WHERE "DeDe" IN r.roles
RETURN actor.name, movie.title, r.roles

name: Find the director’s names of movies where Madonna and Tom Hanks were co-actors.
query:
MATCH (madonna:Person {name: "Madonna"})-[:ACTED_IN]->(m:Movie)<-[:ACTED_IN]-(tom:Person {name: "Tom Hanks"})
MATCH (director:Person)-[:DIRECTED]->(m)
RETURN DISTINCT director.name AS Director, m.title AS Movie

name: Find all actors that acted in a movie together after 2009 (release date, 2009 included) and return the list of actor names along with the movie node.
query:
MATCH (actor:Person)-[:ACTED_IN]->(m:Movie)
WHERE m.released >= 2009
RETURN m.title AS Movie, COLLECT(actor.name) AS Actors, m.released

name: By extending the previous query, find all movies where the cast of the movies found before also acted in. For instance, if C(m) = {a1, a2} is the list of actors (the cast) of a movie m in the previous answer, then, one seeks for movies m′ such that the cast C(m′) contains C(m).
Match pairs of reviewers and those they follow directly or via a third reviewer
query:
MATCH (r1:Person)-[:FOLLOWS*1..3]->(r2:Person)
RETURN DISTINCT r1.name AS Reviewer, r2.name AS FollowedReviewer

name: Count the number of more-than-70-years-old actors reachable in at most 4 hops starting from Clint Eastwood and following the ACTED_IN relationship through movies. For instance, a valid pattern is clint →m1 ←p1 →m2 ←p2 with mi the movies and pi the elders. p1 is 1-hop from clint, whereas p2 is 2-hops. Each pi of the chain is born before 1954. This is “the elder network”
query:
MATCH (clint:Person {name: "Clint Eastwood"})-[:ACTED_IN*..4]-(elder:Person)
WHERE elder.born < 1954 AND elder <> clint
RETURN COUNT(DISTINCT elder) AS NumElders

name: List the number of more-than-70-years-old actors reachable in at most 4 hops starting from Clint Eastwood and following the ACTED_IN relationship through movies. For instance, a valid pattern is clint →m1 ←p1 →m2 ←p2 with mi the movies and pi the elders. p1 is 1-hop from clint, whereas p2 is 2-hops. Each pi of the chain is born before 1954. This is “the elder network”
query:
MATCH (clint:Person {name: "Clint Eastwood"})-[:ACTED_IN*..4]-(elder:Person)
WHERE elder.born < 1954 AND elder <> clint
RETURN DISTINCT elder.name AS ElderActor, elder.born AS BirthYear

name: Find actors with top 10 – sort of – Katz centrality along ACTED_IN edges (through movies). Return actor vertex and Katz centrality
query:
MATCH (a:Person)
WITH a, 
  SIZE([(a)-[:ACTED_IN]->(:Movie)<-[:ACTED_IN]-(p:Person) | p]) AS w1,
  SIZE([(a)-[:ACTED_IN]->(:Movie)<-[:ACTED_IN]-(:Person)-[:ACTED_IN]->(:Movie)<-[:ACTED_IN]-(p2:Person) | p2]) AS w2,
  SIZE([(a)-[:ACTED_IN*3]->(p3:Person) | p3]) AS w3,
  SIZE([(a)-[:ACTED_IN*4]->(p4:Person) | p4]) AS w4
WITH a, (w1*1.0) + (w2*0.5) + (w3*0.333) + (w4*0.25) AS KatzCentrality
RETURN a.name AS Actor, KatzCentrality
ORDER BY KatzCentrality DESC
LIMIT 10

name: Return the whole graph as a simple adjacency list of vertex ids (id(.) scalar function) ordered by decreasing vertex degree.
query:
MATCH (n)
OPTIONAL MATCH (n)--(neighbor)
WITH id(n) AS nodeId, COLLECT(DISTINCT id(neighbor)) AS adjacency, SIZE(COLLECT(DISTINCT neighbor)) AS degree
ORDER BY degree DESC
RETURN nodeId, adjacency, degree

name: Persons
query:
MATCH (p:Person)
RETURN id(p) AS person_id, p.name AS name, p.born AS born

name: Movies
query:
MATCH (m:Movie)
RETURN id(m) AS movie_id, m.title AS title, m.released AS released

name: Acted_In
query:
MATCH (p:Person)-[r:ACTED_IN]->(m:Movie)
RETURN 
  id(r) AS rel_id,
  id(p) AS person_id,
  p.name AS actor_name,
  p.born AS actor_born,
  id(m) AS movie_id,
  m.title AS movie_title,
  m.released AS movie_released,
  r.roles AS roles

name: Directed
query:
MATCH (p:Person)-[r:DIRECTED]->(m:Movie)
RETURN 
  id(r) AS rel_id,
  id(p) AS person_id,
  p.name AS director_name,
  p.born AS director_born,
  id(m) AS movie_id,
  m.title AS movie_title,
  m.released AS movie_released

name: Follows
query:
MATCH (p1:Person)-[r:FOLLOWS]->(p2:Person)
RETURN 
  id(r) AS rel_id,
  id(p1) AS follower_id,
  p1.name AS follower_name,
  p1.born AS follower_born,
  id(p2) AS followed_id,
  p2.name AS followed_name,
  p2.born AS followed_born
